basic.description: The growth of Rome from the Neolithic period to Late Antiquity based on archaeological, literary, epigraphical evidence. A.M. Foley (May be offered jointly with CLST-405*. There are additional requirements for students at the graduate level but these are determined at the onset of the course.)  A.M. Foley or B. Reeves.
basic.subject: CLAS
basic.title: Topography Of Rome
